channel.title: C++ question
channel.description:
I started learning C++ recently at school, but I need help for 1 thing. The teacher showed us something to handle special characters in Windows console. It was something like:
[code]locale bla bla[/code]
It was so I could use characters é è à and other ones.

item.title: C++ question
item.dc:creator: @Hash1 Hash1
item.description:
@Hash1 wrote:

iKilem:

You didn’t copy the code exactly did you? You need to initialise std::locale with the appropriate argument(s). An empty string means use the user’s preferred locale. Also note that cout.imbue() will only imbue the locale to cout. What are you trying to do exactly?

I’m doing a basic console calculator, but the special characters such as: ‘é’ or ‘à’ displays as weird characters in console.
